717977f-a.folder: Canal Street & Ludlow Street, Manhattan, NY
717977f-a.text:
(1)
Canal Street (running from foreground to rear) east from and including Ludlow Street (left fore, where truck is visible) to and including East Broadway (where it terminates), and showing the latter thoroughfare forming approximately a 160 degree angle and proceeding, essentially, in the same (eastward) direction. Also shown (center of view) is Seward Park extending from Essex, east to Jefferson Streets. Across same, appears the Seward Park branch of the New York Public Library, on the east side of Jefferson Street, from East Broadway to Division Street. In the right foreground are shown Nos. 135 to 143 Division Street, south side, where it meets Canal Street. It suspends its course there and resumes again at the eastern edge of the Park, at the library. This picture was taken from the 12-story building No. 54-58 Canal Street, at the S.W. corner of Orchard Street and includes a panoramic view of the surrounding area with the Williamsburg Bridge in
the distance.
May 9, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing a more inclusive view. Note (on the right) the 10-story Jewish Daily Forward Building, 173-175 East Broadway, and slightly eastward, at the S.E. corner of Jefferson Street, the 5-story
Educational Alliance Building.
May 9, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

717980f-a.folder: Canal Street & Ludlow Street, Manhattan, NY
717980f-a.text: 35-31 Canal Street, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Ludlow Street. Shown at No. 31 is Loew's Canal Street Theatre, a motion picture house. September 25, 1935.

717981f-a.folder: Canal Street & Division Street, Manhattan, NY
717981f-a.text:
(1)
The intersection of Canal and Division Streets, as seen
from Ludlow Street.
September 24, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from a different angle.
September 25, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same as No. 1. Canal Street is in the foreground.
April 28, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

719322f-a.folder: Division Street & Canal Street, Manhattan, NY
719322f-a.text:
Division (left) a Canal (eight), at Ludlow Street's. The latter runs across the view and permits the apex of the convergance to rest upon the west side of same. At the left is a cleared area on Division Street.This
is detailed in View 2.
June 24, 1939
No's. 1-2
P. L. 3perr
